body: Grow approximately 10,000 worms on 2 x 150 mm NGM plates seeded with E. coli OP50 bacteria.
Harvest worms and wash them 3 times with 15 ml of M9 buffer.
Wash worms once with 15 ml of ddH2O.
Resuspend worms in 3 ml of ice cold MIB and transfer them into a 7 ml dounce homogenizer on ice.
Centrifuge at 200 g for 5 min and keep supernatant.
Centrifuge at 800 g for 10 min and keep supernatant.
Centrifuge at high-speed 12,000 g for 10 min to pellet the total mitochondria.
MIB is removed and replaced by 500 µl of ice cold PEB.
Add 100 µg of anti-HA magnetic beads.
Incubate samples at 4 °C for 1 h while rotating at 10 rpm.
Transfer the samples on a homemade setup consisting of a column and a magnet.
Ensure that beads were attracted to the side of the tip and held by the magnet and then wash twice with 25 ml of ice cold PEB.
After washings, resuspend the beads in 20 µl of MIB.
